content.body: bakkot: Do we have ES2023 nicely typeset, or should we get someone to help with this again, like Alan did for ES2022?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: Do we have ES2023 nicely typeset, or should we get someone to help with this again, like Alan did for ES2022?

content.body: littledan: we do not and the editors do not think it is worth prioritizing that effort
content.formatted_body: littledan: we do not and the editors do not think it is worth prioritizing that effort

content.body: bakkot: I'm just trying to tell Ecma, hey, the editors aren't doing this; if we as a standards body want this done, then we should find a vendor to do so
content.formatted_body: bakkot: I'm just trying to tell Ecma, hey, the editors aren't doing this; if we as a standards body want this done, then we should find a vendor to do so

content.body: for this to take place, it would have to be a request originating from TC39. I don't see any harm in doing that.
so I was going to start an email thread about this--the Ecma secretariat is under the impression that the editor group will handle this themselves.
also give that Michael had found a vendor before (which I'm trying to dig up), it'd be nice to send that reference (and ideally the others that Michael evaluated) to Ecma for their use
indeed, the editors are not intending to produce anything nicer than the print-to-pdf option
I can handle arguing with Ecma--I'm not asking for a lot from you here
